alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 4:21AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bradford and north central Alachua Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 421 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Worthington Spring, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, penny size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Alachua, La Crosse and Brooker. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
